author: Michael Diamond
author_info: NYU | Academic Director & Clinical Assistant Professor. NYU School of Professional Studies | Marketing, PR & Corporate Communications
content:
Proud to support our colleague Dr. Lilian Ajayi Ore, Ed.D. who teaches in the NYU SPS Integrated Marketing & Communications program.  She's been nominated for a Top 100 Learning and Development Professional Award, from the OnCon Icon Awards.

Dr. Lilian Ajayi Ore, Ed.D. received her Doctor of Education Degree from the University of Pennsylvania, as part of their highly-respected Chief Learning Officer program; and is a much-admired teacher of web analytics and digital marketing at the NYU School of Professional Studies.

https://lnkd.in/dpBnDPaP

From all her students and faculty colleagues at NYU SPS we wish you the best of luck.

Martin Ihrig, Negar Farakish, PMP, Ed.D., Anna A. Tavis, Ph.D, Shoshana Bass, Sonjaya Singh Gaur, Milos Bujisic, Bahriye Goren-Gulek

author: Steve Isaacs
author_info: Education Program Manager at Epic Games
content:
One year ago today I started as the Education Program Manager at Epic Games after being a classroom teacher for 28 years! Imagine - getting to support education for Epic Games! (yeah, I pinch myself often)

The company culture is amazing and despite starting during the pandemic I have had the great pleasure of working closely with so many incredible people across so many teams at Epic. 

I have also developed great relationships and partnerships with many organizations that share our passion to support students to learn skills that truly prepare them for the jobs of tomorrow (really today!). 

In my role, I get to work with a great team to provide resources, support, and training to educators to help them bring tools like #UnrealEngine, #Twinmotion, and #FortniteCreative to their secondary classroom. 

I'm quite grateful to everyone who has been part of this journey. I am super excited to enter year two as we have so many exciting projects and programs in place and things at Epic continue to be, well, Epic!

#education #educators #fortnite #edtech #games4ed

author: Henry Innis
content:
Really pleased to have Anita Deutsch join the Mutiny team today as GM Customer. 

We committed at the start of 2022 to building a Customer function that reflected how WarChest could transform businesses, enhance onboarding and investing in educating the market about the power of Marketing Investment Analytics. 

Anita as a leader joining gives me tremendous confidence that we are building the team, people and processes to begin that journey. 

Building new categories of technology is hard. You can only do it with the best people. We're so lucky to have a committed and brilliant team focused on doing just that.

author: Jessica James, MEd, MA
author_info: Dynamic Learning and Development Professional seeking challenging opportunities in Tech/EdTech
content:
So,
The first line in your job description is “No, Teachers please!” 

But

You list the requirements and the first line is:

Bachelors Degree in Human Resources, EDUCATION, or Business Administration 

So WHO OTHER THAN A TEACHER WOULD GET A DEGREE IN EDUCATION????

Make it make sense.
